body_text.text: Despite physician and patient interest in vitamin D, its role in health and disease beyond bone is conflicting, and guidance for decision-making is needed.
There is an enormous body of data that shows exercise is good for health. Recently, there has been concern that repetitive, intense exercise may have deleterious cardiovascular effects.
body_text.section: Exercise and Health: Dose and Response, Considering Both Ends of the Curve Harvey B. Simon

body_text.text: This review suggests that a new conditionpostmodern stress disorder-is emerging. Possibly a variant of posttraumatic stress disorder, postmodern stress disorder is related to repetitive exposure to digital images of violence. Patients with ankylosing spondylitis frequently have cardiac abnormalities, but they more often consist of disease-related aortic regurgitation or conduction system abnormalities than manifestations of atherosclerotic heart disease.
body_text.section: Postmodern Stress Disorder (PMSD): A Possible New Disorder Arnold R. Eiser
